content: Great article! The Server Components explanation was really clear and helpful.
I've been using Server Components in production for a few months now, and the performance improvements are real. One tip: be careful about data fetching waterfalls!
The generics examples are spot on. I especially liked the API client example - that's exactly how I structure my fetch wrappers.
Could you elaborate more on generic constraints? I find them confusing sometimes.
The multi-stage build example saved me so much image size. Went from 1.2GB to 150MB!
Don't forget to add a .dockerignore file! Makes builds much faster.
This is incredibly helpful! The partial indexes tip alone probably saved me hours of debugging.
We implemented connection pooling based on this article and saw a 40% reduction in database connection errors. Thank you!
Zod is a game changer for API validation. Never going back to manual validation.
Really resonates with my experience. Year 3 is definitely when everything started clicking for me.
As someone in year 2, this gives me a great roadmap. Thanks for sharing!
Server Actions are amazing for forms. No more useEffect and state management mess!
The progressive enhancement aspect is huge. Works without JS is a big win for accessibility.
CSS Grid is so powerful once you understand it. The auto-fit/auto-fill pattern is my favorite.
Subgrid support is finally getting better! Can't wait to use it more widely.
